intro: Ptychococcus albertisianus, commonly known as the Albert's pocket gopher cactus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cactaceae. It is native to the arid regions of northern Mexico and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and spiny exterior. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are often clustered at the top of the stem. It has a shallow root system adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
